title: Data on individual churches
text: Get tidy data Church England churches.
code: coe_churches(where = "ChurchCode = 608186") |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 11 #> $ church_code       <int> 608186 #> $ parish_name       <chr> "Leytonstone: St Margaret w St Columba" #> $ parish_code       <int> 580186 #> $ benefice_name     <chr> "Leytonstone St Marg w St Columba" #> $ benefice_id       <chr> "08/265 M" #> $ deanery_name      <chr> "WALTHAM FOREST" #> $ deanery_id        <int> 58108 #> $ archdeaconry_name <chr> "WEST HAM" #> $ archdeaconry_id   <int> 581 #> $ diocese_name      <chr> "Chelmsford" #> $ diocese_number    <int> 8

title: Data on individual churches
text: Get parish code given church(es).

title: Data on individual churches
text: tiny function returns names fields used Feature Server Churches provided CoE Data Services ESRI.

title: Reading CoE statistics
text: Display information datasets available package. Default return two-column tibble including ons_id description, setting description = FALSE return character vector valid nomis codes can passed functions coe_census()
code: coe_datasets() |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 15 #> Columns: 2 #> $ ons_id      <chr> "TS001", "TS004", "TS007A", "TS021", "TS030", "TS037", "TS… #> $ description <chr> "TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and commu…

title: Reading CoE statistics
text: Get statistics particular topic, particular geographical level, filtering required. Levels include ‘parish’, ‘diocese’ ‘england’. Parishes can filtered parish codes dioceses diocese numbers, national-level tables comprised single row filtered.
code: coe_census(ons_id =  "TS001", level = "england") #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   population lives_in_a_household lives_in_a_communal_establishment #>        <dbl>                <dbl>                             <dbl> #> 1   56490048             55504302                            985746 coe_census(ons_id = "TS001", level = "diocese", areas = 1) #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   diocese_name diocese_number population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>        <chr>               <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 Bath & Wells 1                  979315              959638. #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

title: Reading CoE statistics
code: coe_parish_census_context(parish_code = "370047", ons_ids = "TS001") #> ✔ Reading from coeparishdata_parish-data. #> ✔ Range ''TS001''. #> $TS001 #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons  #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   level   level_code level_name                population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>                          <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 parish  370047     South Dulwich: St Stephen       6680                0.983 #> 2 diocese 37         Southwark                    2879124                0.988 #> 3 nation  NA         england                     56490048                0.983 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

what: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: coeparishdata data package ’s built around various datasets made available Church England’s Data Services team. Data sources include: Parish-level census data ONS’ 2021 Census England Wales (Updated November 2024) database Churches, Parishes, Dioceses geographies (Updated November 2024) Parish-level data 2019 Index Multiple Deprivation (PENDING) National-level data sourced directly ONS data via nomis (via nomisr).

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: can install development version coeparishdata GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Church-Army/coeparishdata")

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: Full documentation website : https://Church-Army.github.io/coeparishdata

title: Interface to Parish Level Census Data Provided by the Church of England
text: Aggregating parish data causes considerable rounding error Add data-dictionary vignettes Create print methods "coe_parish_data" class Create methods dplyr preserve attributes "coe_parish_data" objects Add IMD data Ensure appropriate credit/attribution/documentation Rename everything, perhaps including package

what: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
text: Get census data Church England parish, diocesan national level.

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
code: coe_census(ons_id, level, areas, relative = FALSE)

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
text: ons_id ONS id required data. Must one coe_datasets(). level geographical level data required. Must one 'parish', 'diocese' 'england'. areas character vector parish codes diocese numbers. specified, returned tibble contain data areas. used level = 'england'. NA values removed. relative Logical. returned table contain absolute statitiscs (e.g. persons/households) proportions area?

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
text: tibble::tibble() containing census data Church England

title: Get census data for the Church of England at a parish, diocesan or national level. — coe_census
code: coe_census(ons_id =  "TS001", level = "england") #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   population lives_in_a_household lives_in_a_communal_establishment #>        <dbl>                <dbl>                             <dbl> #> 1   56490048             55504302                            985746 coe_census(ons_id = "TS001", level = "diocese", areas = 1) #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  persons  #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   diocese_name diocese_number population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>        <chr>               <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 Bath & Wells 1                  979315              959638. #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl>

what: Get data on the Anglican geography on Church of England Churches, including their parish, benefice, arcdeaconry and diocese. — coe_churches
title: Get data on the Anglican geography on Church of England Churches, including their parish, benefice, arcdeaconry and diocese. — coe_churches
text: Reads church data Church England's Data Services ESRI feature server, dropping spatial data returning tibble::tibble().

what: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_census_context
title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_census_context
text: Extracts parish, diocese national level data given parish, base::rbinds single table. Iterates ons_ids output list tables

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_census_context
code: coe_parish_census_context(   parish_code,   ons_ids = coe_datasets(description = FALSE),   relative = TRUE )

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_census_context
text: parish_code single parish code. Character. ons_ids character vector ons_ids. relative Logical. outputs relative? Default TRUE.

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_census_context
text: list coe_parish_data tibbles

title: Get a (list of) comparative table(s) of local, diocesan and national data for a given parish — coe_parish_census_context
code: coe_parish_census_context(parish_code = "370047", ons_ids = "TS001") #> ✔ Reading from coeparishdata_parish-data. #> ✔ Range ''TS001''. #> $TS001 #> Church of England Census Data #> TS001 - Number of usual residents in households and communal establishments  #> Units:  Proportion of all persons  #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   level   level_code level_name                population lives_in_a_household #>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>                          <dbl>                <dbl> #> 1 parish  370047     South Dulwich: St Stephen       6680                0.983 #> 2 diocese 37         Southwark                    2879124                0.988 #> 3 nation  NA         england                     56490048                0.983 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: lives_in_a_communal_establishment <dbl> #>

what: National statistics socio-economic classification levels — ns_sec_descriptions
title: National statistics socio-economic classification levels — ns_sec_descriptions
text: reference table describes NS-SEC classifications socio-economic status compounded create measures provided coe_data package. measures used ONS dataset 'TS062'.

title: National statistics socio-economic classification levels — ns_sec_descriptions
code: ns_sec_descriptions

title: National statistics socio-economic classification levels — ns_sec_descriptions
text: tibble 15 rows 3 columns: stat_name Statistic name used coe_data datasets sub_category_code Numerical code corresonding NS-SEC sub-category sub_category_description Description sub-category

title: National statistics socio-economic classification levels — ns_sec_descriptions
text: https://www.ons.gov.uk/datasets/TS062/editions/2021/versions/1
